clinical_study.brief_title: Stimulation of Efferent Loop Prior to Ileostomy Closure

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital Universitario Virgen de la Arrixaca

clinical_study.source: Hospital Universitario Virgen de la Arrixaca

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to compare postoperative ileus between stimulated and unstimulated patients prior to ileostomy closure.

detailed_description.textblock: Stimulation was performed ten days prior to the intervention, through the efferent limb of the ileostomy with 500 cc of a thickening substance (saline and nutritional thickener)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.time_frame: within the first days after surgery

arm_group.description: unstimulated patients prior to surgery,ileostomy closure surgery without prior stimulation of efferent limb.
stimulation of the efferent limb of the ileostomy prior to ileostomy closure.

intervention.description: daily stimulation of efferent loop prior to surgery (ileostomy closure)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- protective ileostomy after rectal cancer surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- under 18 years

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Hospital Universitario Virgen de la Arrixaca
